Oregon AWARE offers FREE CE/CME opportunities for Providers. Check out their descriptions below!

The Oregon Alliance Working for Antibiotic Resistance Education. 

 Our mission: To encourage the appropriate use of antibiotics to reduce the problem of antibiotic resistant bacteria in OR. 

 We offer a variety of materials for Health Care Professionals, Health Educators, and Students to help them convey our message to the general public. 

 This App highlights some of the resources available for Providers for treatment of their Adult Patients.

Credit available from AMA-PRA, AAFP, Oregon Board of Pharmacy for Physicians, PAs, nurses, and pharmacists. 
 
 41-page article with practice guidelines for acute otitis media, sinusitis, bronchitis, pharyngitis, community acquired pneumonia, and prevention of respiratory infections. 
 
 CME is obtained when participants complete an evaluation form and score 75% or higher on the post-test.

Credits available through the Childrenâ€™s Hospital of Pittsburg, Pediatrics Medical Education. 

 Must create a login on the site in order to participate. 

 CME provided to Physicians, Trainees, Educators, and other Health Professionals. 

 Courses through the site that offer CME: Tympanometry and Acoustic Reflexometry; Diagnosis of Acute Otitis Media; Diagnosis of Acute Otitis Media with Effusion; Pneumatic Otoscopy. 

 Each program takes 30-60 minutes to complete and may be done in multiple sessions.

Training developed by MARR Coalition and Wayne State University School of Medicine. 

 Must create account/login information. 

 Webinar outlining the appropriate antibiotics management of URIs focusing on antibiotic resistance, treatment guidelines, and patient satisfaction.
Antibiotic Resistance: Community Pharmacists Tip the Scale.

For Pharmacists, sponsored by the CDC, and accredited by the ACPE. 


 1-hour continuing education course of 5 modules.
Antimicrobial Drug Use and Resistance in Europe

Course offered through the Emerging Infectious Diseases Journal with CE credits provided by Medscape, LLC. 


 Read a journal article and taking a post-test, as well as completing an evaluation.
Group A Strep Management in Adults
